result.execSummary:
All charges against Lynn A Cruz in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lynn A Cruz is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lynn A Cruz

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on September 29th, 2022.
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt:
Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Thomas C Simon.

LF 9/9/22--sent to BC.

3:32 PM Defendant Lynn A Cruz in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Lynn A Cruz.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court was set for plea and sentencing. Defense requests a status in 90 days with respect to orders from another court of competent jurisdiction. 
State may be willing to dismiss case.
Court passes the case for parties to discuss.
4:13 PM with the same appearances. 
Case moves to dismiss without prejudice.
Court grants. Case is Dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

09:04 AM Defendant Lynn A Cruz in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.

Judge Carter is hearing case for Judge Dorow. 

Atty Simon is requesting a plea/sentencing hearing with Judge Dorow. Deferred prosecution agreement reached with the State. Court sets.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:38 AM Defendant Lynn A Cruz in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Simon requests to enter a plea of Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect and requests an Order for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).
The Court notes that even if found NGI, the term of commitment would be relatively short. 
The Court requests attorney Simon to get any other commitment paperwork to the State to see if an amended offer can be sought. 
The Court will not appove the NGI plea at this time and will adjourn for the parties to talk.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

09:31 AM Defendant Lynn A Cruz in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status.
Defense has received discovery.
Defense just received an offer.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

08:44 AM Defendant Lynn A Cruz in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is waiting for discovery.
  Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:46 AM Defendant Lynn A Cruz in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 03/25/2022. (BC)

LF 3/25--sent to BC; mailed copy of Order and payment letter to defendant.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
